intro: Drejerella, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Drejerella typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical structure includes alternate, hairy leaves and a basal rosette growth habit.
